functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

msg.content: Who won the most MVPs among the top 5 scorers in the NBA?
Who won the most MVPs among the top 5 scorers in the NBA?

function.name: delegate
function.arguments: {"instructions":"Find out who the top 5 scorers in NBA history are and then determine which of them has won the most MVP awards."}

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Find out who the top 5 scorers in NBA history are and then determine which of them has won the most MVP awards.

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query":"List of National Basketball Association career scoring leaders"}

msg.content:
No page with that title exists. Try searching for one of these similar articles instead:
- List of NBA career scoring leaders
- List of NBA annual scoring leaders
- List of WNBA career scoring leaders
- List of NBA career 3-point scoring leaders
- List of NBA career playoff scoring leaders
- List of NBA single-game scoring leaders
- List of NBA franchise career scoring leaders
- List of NBA career free throw scoring leaders
- List of NBA career playoff 3-point scoring leaders
- List of WNBA career 3-point scoring leaders
msg.name: search

article_title: List of NBA career scoring leaders

msg.content:
<document>
<title>List of NBA career scoring leaders</title>
<fragment>
![](image)LeBron James has scored the most career points and is the youngest to reach every point milestone from 1,000 to 38,000 in NBA history.[1]
This article contains two charts: The first chart is a list of the top 50 all-time scorers in the history of the National Basketball Association (NBA). The list includes only points scored in regular season games. The second chart is a progressive list of the leading all-time NBA scorers.[2] LeBron James is the leading scorer in NBA history.




## Scoring leaders[edit]


The following is a list of National Basketball Association players by total career regular season points scored.



*Statistics accurate as of November 18, 2023.*


|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ^
 | Active NBA player
 |
| \*
 | Inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame |
| †
 | Not yet eligible for Hall of Fame consideration[a] |
| §
 | 1st time eligible for Hall of Fame in 2024[3] |




</fragment>
<fragment>
Progression of career scoring leaders
![](image)
Joe Fulks held the career scoring record from the league's inaugural season in 1946 to 1952 and was the first player to eclipse 5,000 career points.
![](image)
George Mikan held the record from 1952 to 1958 and was the first player to eclipse 10,000 career points.
![](image)
Ed Macauley held the record for 39 days in 1958, the shortest in NBA history.
![](image)
Dolph Schayes held the record from 1958 to 1964 and was the first player to eclipse 15,000 career points.
![](image)
Bob Pettit held the record from 1964 to 1966 and is the first player to eclipse 20,000 career points.
![](image)
Wilt Chamberlain held the record from 1966 to 1984 and was the first player to eclipse 25,000 and 30,000 career points. He played the fewest games to reach every point milestone from 1,000 to 31,000 in NBA history.
![](image)

</fragment>
<fragment>

Scoring leader at the end of every season

</fragment>

## See also[edit]


* ![icon](image)Basketball portal
* ![](image)Sports portal


* List of NBA regular season records
* Point (basketball)
* List of National Basketball Association annual scoring leaders
* List of National Basketball Association career playoff scoring leaders
* List of National Basketball Association career 3-point scoring leaders
* List of National Basketball League (United States) scoring leaders
* List of National Basketball Association single-game scoring leaders
* List of National Basketball Association career minutes played leaders


## Notes[edit]


1. **^** A player is not eligible for induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame until he has been fully retired for three calendar years.
2. **^** American Basketball Association (ABA) teams other than those admitted into the NBA in 1976 are not included; each year is linked to an article about that particular NBA season.
3. **^** Rounded to the nearest tenth.
4. **^** First adopted in the 1979–80 season.
